intro: Seseli selinoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf cowparsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. Seseli selinoides is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these specialized environments.
